records.location_details: A group of 22 migrants landed on Lesvos, Greece. 17 migrants were apprehended, ill-treated, and pushed back to Türkiye, abandoned in a life raft off Izmir province, Dikili district, at 38°54′06″N, 26°47'36"E in Turkish territorial waters, South-East of Lesvos island. The journey started from Canakkale, Türkiye.
records.where_clear: Lesvos Island, Greece and Turkish territorial waters near Izmir province
records.location_text_raw: Lesvos and split into two sub-groups

possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 2 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union
Article 19 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union

possible_violations.violation_name: Prohibition of inhuman or degrading treatment
possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 4 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union

records.context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office reiterates its concern about the pushback policy implemented by the Greek authorities, and incorrect reporting of incidents in [redacted] which contributes to hiding this reality.
records.evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office established that the 17 migrants were ill-treated, subjected to theft of property, and ultimately pushed back to Türkiye by the Hellenic Coast Guard and/or individuals acting in concert and coordination with the Greek authorities.

records.location_details: A migrant recounted two attempts to irregularly reach Samos on 12/11/2022 and Lesvos on 12/01/2023. Both incidents involved groups of migrants being intercepted near Samos/Lesvos, taken to Turkish territorial waters, and abandoned in life rafts, eventually rescued by the Turkish Coast Guard. Departure from Canakkale, Turkey for Lesvos attempt.
records.where_clear: Samos Island, Lesvos Island, and Turkish territorial waters (Aegean Sea)
records.geocodable_query: Samos Island, Greece; Lesvos Island, Greece; Aegean Sea
records.uncertainty_note: Specific incident locations are not precisely geocoded, only general islands and sea areas.

possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 2 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union
Article 19 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union

possible_violations.violation_name: Prohibition of inhuman or degrading treatment
possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 4 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union

records.context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office regrets the limited response to its enquiry by the Greek authorities who had refused to provide information regarding the activities of specific assets possibly involved in both incidents and remains concerned about the gaps in reporting of authorities' actions with potential adverse impact on fundamental rights.
records.evidence_quote: The Office assesses that it is plausible that the migrant was collected by uniformed armed men on Lesvos on 12/01/2023, loaded on a Hellenic Coast Guard vessel, taken to Turkey, and abandoned with others in two drifting life rafts, as alleged. These actions, if verified, would constitute prohibited collective expulsion and a threat to migrants' right to life.

records.location_details: A migrant claimed ill-treatment by Serbian police near the Serbian-Bulgarian border on 19 March 2023, after having entered Hungary from Serbia on 18 March 2023. He had been staying in Sombor migrant camp for about 25 days.
records.where_clear: Serbia, near Serbian-Bulgarian border, after entering Hungary from Serbia
records.location_text_raw: Serbian-Bulgarian border, close to a river
records.uncertainty_note: Exact location of ill-treatment is not specified, only general area.

possible_violations.violation_name: Prohibition of inhuman or degrading treatment

possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 4 of Protocol no. 4 to the ECHR

records.context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office underlines the importance of thorough follow-up and robust investigations by national authorities whenever such severe allegations are being brought to their attention.
records.evidence_quote: While the Fundamental Rights Office considers it credible that the migrant sustained injuries, it could not conclusively establish under what circumstances he incurred them. Allegations of Serbian officers' involvement in fundamental rights violations, and specifically the use of electric shocks, were denied by the Serbian authorities, and could not be independently corroborated by the Fundamental Rights Office.

records.location_details: A migrant alleged that on 22/04/2023, a Frontex vessel stopped their boat in Greek territorial waters north of Lesvos, destroyed its engine, and towed it to Türkiye. The migrant later retracted these allegations, stating the boat was intercepted and threatened with a weapon, then handed over to a Greek vessel which escorted them to Türkiye. The group consisted of 17 migrants.
records.where_clear: North of Lesvos Island, in Greek and Turkish territorial waters (Aegean Sea)
records.geocodable_query: North of Lesvos Island, Aegean Sea
records.uncertainty_note: Exact coordinates not provided, only general area.

possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 2 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union
Article 19 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union

possible_violations.violation_name: Prohibition of inhuman or degrading treatment
possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 4 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union

records.context_note: The migrant's account of events proved to be untrue as regards the allegations against Frontex and overall unreliable. Available evidence has disproven allegations of towing, engine destruction, drawing of weapons, and of a pushback from Greece to Türkiye. The Fundamental Rights Office concludes that the fundamental rights of migrants have not been violated by Frontex or the Hellenic Coast Guard.
records.evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office established with certainty that the migrant boat had been intercepted by the Frontex vessel in Greek territorial waters, and subsequently turned and headed back to Türkiye by its own means, being followed by the Frontex vessel.
